section.name: Introduction
section.p: Force Field X is a collaboration to develop computational tools for molecular biophysics, including state-of-the-art features for X-ray crystallography and structure based pharmacuetical engineering.

subsection.name: Force Field X Parent Project
subsection.p: The Force Field X parent project provides:

ul.li: Shared infrastructure for the development of modules (like this website, mailing lists, forums, code repositories, etc.).
Aggregate documentaion of the source code, API documentation, unit testing and known issues.
A variety of user interfaces that run on all platforms. This includes a GUI, command line version, scripting based on Groovy and even dissemination via Java Webstart.

subsection.p: The Force Field X parent project is analogous to a rather liberitarian Federal government. It costs nothing and the idea is to reach consensus on issues that arise.

subsection.name: Force Field X Modules
subsection.p: Force Field X modules are lead by PIs, postdoctoral scholars or graduate students. Module boundaries are sometimes a bit arbitrary, but so are the borders of states or countries. If you have an idea for a new Force Field X Module, please contact an existing member of the team.
